info.title: PDFco
info.description: PDF.co is the set of PDF tools from Data extraction to Document Parser. Generate PDF, Read unstructured PDF, Fill PDF Forms, Add Text/Images to PDF, Split PDF, Merge PDF, Convert Pdf tables to CSV, JSON, XML and much more.

margins.description: Override default margins with custom values (the order is `top right bottom left`). You can als set all margins: `10px`, `5mm`, `5in` for all sides.

paperSize.description: Select PDF paper size. Can be Letter, Legal, Tabloid, Ledger, A0, A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6 or a custom size. Custom size can be set in px (pixels), mm or in (inches) with width and height separated by space like this: 200 300, 200px 300px, 200mm 300mm, 20cm 30cm or 6in 8in.

lang.description: the language for OCR (text from image) to use for scanned PDF, PNG, and JPG documents input when extracting text. The default is “eng”. Other languages are also supported: deu, spa, chi_sim, jpn, and many others (full list of supported OCR languages is at https://developer.pdf.co/api/pdf-make-text-searchable-or-unsearchable/index.html#language-support). You can also use 2 languages simultaneously like this: eng+deu or jpn+kor (any combination).

searchString.title: Search String

pages.description: Comma-separated list of page indices (or ranges) to process. IMPORTANT: the very first page starts at 0 (zero). To set a range use the dash -, for example: 0,2-5,7-. To set a range from index to the last page use range like this: 2- (from page #3 as the index starts at zero and till the of the document) for ALL pages just leave this param empty. Example: 0,2-5,7- means the first page, then the 3rd page to the 6th page, and then the range from the 8th (index = 7) page till the end of the document, The input must be in string format.
pages.title: Pages

post.description: Modify a PDF file by searching for specific text and replacing it with new text. Please see api documentation at https://developer.pdf.co/api/pdf-search-and-replace-text/index.html#post-tag-pdf-edit-replace-text for comprehensive guidelines.

url.description: URL to the source file. Supports links from Google Drive, Dropbox, and PDF.co built-in files storage.
url.title: URL

replacementLimit.description: Limit the number of searches & replacements for every item. The default value is 0 which means unlimited searches and replacements so every found occurrence will be replaced.
replacementLimit.title: Replacement Limit

regex.description: Set to true to use regular expression for a search string(s).
regex.title: Is Regex Enabled?

pages.description: Comma-separated list of page indices (or ranges) to process. The very first page starts at 0 (zero). To set a range use the dash -, for example: 0,2-5,7-. To set a range from the index to the last page use range like this: 2- (from page #3 as the index starts at zero and till the of the document). For ALL pages just leave this param empty. Example: 0,2-5,7- means first page, then 3rd page to 6th page, and then the range from 8th (index = 7) page till the end of the document.
pages.title: Pages

password.description: The password of the PDF file
password.title: Password

name.description: File name for the generated output
name.title: Name

expiration.description: Set the expiration time for the output link in minutes (default is 60 i.e 60 minutes or 1 hour), After this specified duration, any generated output file(s) will be automatically deleted from PDF.co temporary files storage. The maximum duration for link expiration varies based on your current subscription plan.
expiration.title: Expiration

pages.description: Comma-separated list of page indices (or ranges) to process. The very first page starts at 0 (zero). To set a range use the dash -, for example: 0,2-5,7-. To set a range from the index to the last page use range like this: 2- (from page #3 as the index starts at zero and till the of the document). For ALL pages just leave this param empty. Example: 0,2-5,7- means first page, then 3rd page to 6th page, and then the range from 8th (index = 7) page till the end of the document.
pages.title: Pages

rect.description: Defines coordinates for extraction, e.g. 51.8, 114.8, 235.5, 204.0. Use PDF.co PDF Edit Add Helper (https://app.pdf.co/pdf-edit-add-helper) to get or measure pdf coordinates.
rect.title: Rectangle

name.description: File name for the generated output

post.description: Convert email files (MSG or EML) code into PDF. Extracts attachments (if any) from input email and embeds into PDF as pdf attachments. Please see api documentation at https://developer.pdf.co/api/pdf-from-email/index.html for comprehensive guidelines.

url.description: URL to the source file. Supports links from Google Drive, Dropbox, and PDF.co built-in files storage.

embedAttachments.description: Set to true to automatically embeds all attachments from original input email MSG or EML files into the final output PDF. Set it to false if you don’t want to embed attachments so it will convert only the body of the input email.
embedAttachments.title: Embed Attachments

convertAttachments.description: Set to false if you don’t want to convert attachments from the original email and want to embed them as original files (as embedded pdf attachments). Converts attachments that are supported by API (DOC, DOCx, HTML, PNG, JPG .etc) into PDF and merges into output final PDF. Non-supported file types are added as PDF attachments (Adobe Reader or another viewer may be required to view PDF attachments).
convertAttachments.title: Convert Attachments

margins.description: set to CSS style margins like 10px, 5mm, 5in for all sides or 5px 5px 5px 5px (the order of margins is top, right, bottom, left).

paperSize.description: Letter is set by default. Can be Letter, Legal, Tabloid, Ledger, A0, A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6 or a custom size. Custom size can be set in px (pixels), mm or in (inches) with width and height separated by space like this: 200 300, 200px 300px, 200mm 300mm, 20cm 30cm or 6in 8in.

post.description: Add password and security limitations to existing PDF. Please see api documentation at https://developer.pdf.co/api/password-and-security/index.html#post-tag-pdf-security-add for comprehensive guidelines.

url.description: URL to the source file. Supports links from Google Drive, Dropbox, and PDF.co built-in files storage.
url.title: URL

ownerPassword.description: The main owner password that is used for document encryption and for setting/removing restrictions.
ownerPassword.title: Owner Password

userPassword.description: The optional user password will be asked for viewing and printing document.
userPassword.title: User Password

encryptionAlgorithm.description: Encryption algorithm. Valid values: RC4_40bit, RC4_128bit, AES_128bit, AES_256bit. AES_128bit or higher is recommended
encryptionAlgorithm.title: Encryption Algorithm

allowAccessibilitySupport.description: Allow or prohibit content extraction for accessibility needs. Note: this restriction applies when userPassword (if any) is entered. This restriction does not apply if the user enters Owner Password.
allowAccessibilitySupport.title: Allow Accessibility Support

allowAssemblyDocument.description: Allow or prohibit assembling the document. Note: this restriction applies when userPassword (if any) is entered. This restriction does not apply if the user enters Owner Password.
allowAssemblyDocument.title: Allow Assembly Document

allowPrintDocument.description: Allow or prohibit printing PDF document. Note: this restriction applies when userPassword (if any) is entered. This restriction does not apply if the user enters Owner Password.
allowPrintDocument.title: Allow Print Document

allowFillForms.description: Allow or prohibit the filling of interactive form fields (including signature fields) in the PDF documents. Note: this restriction applies when userPassword (if any) is entered. This restriction does not apply if the user enters Owner Password.
allowFillForms.title: Allow Fill Forms

allowModifyDocument.description: Allow or prohibit modification of PDF document. Note: this restriction applies when userPassword (if any) is entered. This restriction does not apply if the user enters Owner Password.
allowModifyDocument.title: Allow Modify Document

allowContentExtraction.description: Allow or prohibit copying content from PDF document. Note: this restriction applies when userPassword (if any) is entered. This restriction does not apply if the user enters Owner Password.
allowContentExtraction.title: Allow Content Extraction

allowModifyAnnotations.description: Allow or prohibit interacting with text annotations and forms in PDF document. Note: this restriction applies when userPassword (if any) is entered. This restriction does not apply if the user enters Owner Password.
allowModifyAnnotations.title: Allow Modify Annotations

printQuality.description: Allowed printing quality. Valid values: HighResolution, LowResolution. Note: this restriction applies when userPassword (if any) is entered. This restriction does not apply if the user enters Owner Password.
printQuality.title: Print Quality

name.description: File name for the generated output.
name.title: Name

post.description: Rotate PDF Pages. Please see api documentation at https://developer.pdf.co/api/pdf-rotate-pages/index.html for comprehensive guidelines.

url.description: URL to the source file. Supports links from Google Drive, Dropbox, and PDF.co built-in files storage.
url.title: URL

angle.description: Angle in degrees. Supported values 90, 180, and 270.
angle.title: Angle

pages.description: Comma-separated list of page indices (or ranges) to process. The very first page starts at 0 (zero). To set a range use the dash -, for example: 0,2-5,7-. To set a range from the index to the last page use range like this: 2- (from page #3 as the index starts at zero and till the of the document). For ALL pages just leave this param empty. Example: 0,2-5,7- means first page, then 3rd page to 6th page, and then the range from 8th (index = 7) page till the end of the document.
pages.title: Pages

expiration.description: Set the expiration time for the output link in minutes (default is 60 i.e 60 minutes or 1 hour), After this specified duration, any generated output file(s) will be automatically deleted from PDF.co temporary files storage.
